results.title: My Banquet...
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Chey Scovell
results.brief_description: A digital story made as part of the ‘Diversity @ Work’ Program in association with AMES, Australia Post and SBS. Chey Scovell recounts his childhood growing up as an Australian born in Malaysia and the last four years of schooling spent in Papua New Guinea. He tells of the culture shock he experienced when returning back to Australia.

results.title: A Visit to the dentist
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Adapted from the book “Paddington takes the air”, Paddington visits the dentist and in the course of events, both Paddington and the dentist lose a tooth.

results.title: Paddington and the 'old master'
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington and the Old Master is adapted from Chapters 4,5, and 8 of “A Bear Called Padddington” by Michael Bond. Paddington learns from Mr Gruber, an antique dealer, that old master-pieces are sometimes covered by newer paintings and that the “old master” can be restored. Paddington decides to apply this technique to one of Mr Brown’s paintings with disastrous results. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: To Kill a mockingbird (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Robert Mulligan, Alan Pakula, Brentwood and Pakula-Mulligan Productions
results.brief_description: This is an atmospheric adaptation by Horton Foote of Harper Lee’s sensitive novel of the same name. Told in retrospect, it successfully tackles the themes of racial prejudice in America’s Deep South with the gradual maturing of compassion and social insight in children. Gregory Peck plays Atticus Finch, the soft spoken, small town, Alabama lawyer given the responsibility of defending Tom Robinson, a black man unjustly accused of rape. This is perfectly balanced with Finch as the family man who has the added responsibility of bringing up two motherless and inquisitive children, played by Mary Badham and Phillip Afford. (Awards: Winner of three Academy Awards, including Best Actor for Gregory Peck)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Mulligan, Alan Pakula, Brentwood and Pakula-Mulligan Productions
results.description: This is an atmospheric adaptation by Horton Foote of Harper Lee’s sensitive novel of the same name. This is perfectly balanced with Finch as the family man who has the added responsibility of bringing up two motherless and inquisitive children, played by Mary Badham and Phillip Afford. (Awards: Winner of three Academy Awards, including Best Actor for Gregory Peck)

results.title: Fortune telling
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington Bear visits the fair and consults a fortune teller who advises that his future is rather clouded. Written by Michael Bond, animation by Ivor Wood.

results.title: Paddington in the hot seat. Paddington's puzzle. Paddington takes a cut.
results.creator_credit: Barry Leith, Ivor Wood, Graham Clutterbuck, FilmFair Communications and Paddington
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
1. “Paddington in the hot seat”. Paddington has an audience ticket for the Quiz Show “Sage of Britain”. He gets lost in the studio complex and finds himself “on camera” where he is interviewed by Lionel Parr. He disputes the scoring and provides his opinion on proposed changes to British Television. The viewers jam the switchboard and Paddington is announced “Sage of Britain”. - 2. “Paddington’s puzzle”. Paddington makes a jigsaw puzzle as a present for Mr Gruber from a “priceless” old painting discarded by Mr Curry, some plywood and glue. - 3. “Paddington takes a cut”. Paddington reads “Clippings from my Hedgerow” and dreams he is pruning Mr Currys’ shrub into a peacock shape. Disaster strikes when he snips it leg off! However, awakes before discovery by Mr Curry!
results.title_for_label: Paddington in the hot seat. Paddington’s puzzle. Paddington takes a cut.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Leith, Ivor Wood, Graham Clutterbuck, FilmFair Communications and Paddington

results.title: Paddington recommended
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Adapted from Chapter 6 from the book Paddington Takes the Air. While waiting to dine with the Browns at a fashionable restaurant, Paddington is mistaken for Duncan Hyde, the famous food expert. Hoping for a favourable review in his food guide, the manager offers Paddington a choice of meals on the house. Narrated by Michael Hordern. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Paddington makes a clean sweep
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Mr and Mrs Brown decide to begin spring cleaning and buy a chimney sweeping outfit. While Mr and Mrs Brown go to the sales, Paddington decides to lend a helping paw by cleaning the chimney but encounters problems when the brush becomes detached in the chimney and when he attempts to retrieve it, his head becomes stuck in the chimney pot! Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
